intro: Scleria pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered umbrella sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowering heads. Scleria pauciflora typically grows in wet or seasonally moist habitats, such as marshes and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species in wetland ecosystems and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
